title: Belfairs Woods Walking Route

images.caption: Footpath into Hadleigh Great Wood. This complex entrance is the start of a footpath into the wood.

images.title: Edward Clack / Aerial view of Scrub Lane and Belfairs Nature Reserve
images.caption: Aerial view of Scrub Lane and Belfairs Nature Reserve. The Reserve occupies most of the upper right of the picture. Scrub lane runs from the upper left corner to the bottom centre.

images.title: Edward Clack / Aerial view of Hadleigh Great Wood (Belfairs Nature reserve)
images.caption: Aerial view of Hadleigh Great Wood (Belfairs Nature reserve). The main block of woodland here is the western portion of Hadleigh Great Wood, lying within Castle Point. The bulk of the wood lies within the Southend borough.The road across the bottom right is Scrub Lane. The road curving just below the wood is Greenacres.

description: These woods in Leigh on Sea have some nice trails and lots of interesting flora and fauna to see. You can start off at the car park by the Essex Wildlife Trust Belfairs Nature Discovery Centre on Eastwood Road. Then follow the trails heading west into Belfairs Wood and Hadleigh Great Wood. The nature reserve is a great place for wildlife with Great spotted woodpecker, Nuthatch and the rare heath fritillary butterfly to look out for on the walk. Also look out for the wooden animal sculptures dotted around the trails. It's easy to extend the walk by heading a short distance south west to visit Hadleigh Country Park . The popular park is nearly 400 acres in size and includes a mix of woodland, pasture, hay meadow and marsh.
